intro: Clidemia heteronervis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Clidemia heteronervis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks, where it thrives in humid, warm climates.
